item.title: Music / Abnormal Sleepz
item.dc:creator: farrantjames97
item.description:
Abnormal Sleepz is part of the meteorical rise of Manchester talent ...over the last few years, his debut album 'Kaleidoscope' in 2019 made ... waves within the scene, and his blend of Hip Hop, Soul and Grime has become more and more recognisable in recent months ...

The post <span>Music</span><span id=hspan2> /</span><span id=hspan3> Abnormal Sleepz</span> appeared first on SUM.
item.content:encoded:
Abnormal Sleepz is part of the meteorical rise of Manchester talent over the last few years, his debut album ‘Kaleidoscope’ in 2019 made waves within the scene, and his blend of Hip Hop, Soul and Grime has become more and more recognisable in recent months. 

1.What made you start a career in music? Did you ever consider doing anything else?

I grew up in a musical household, so naturally I always had a bond with music. It was a hobby as well as something I wanted to pursue as a career whether it be as a DJ or an artist, it didn’t really matter as long as it involved music. When I was younger I was into basketball too so my time was split between the two but I left that behind in college, I grew out of my love for it and wanted to pursue music more.

2. How have you developed as an Artist since releasing your first solo mixtape “The Meditape” ?

I’ve matured more and gained an understanding of my identity. Since Meditape I had started producing again but taking it more seriously which allowed me to truly create my own sound.


With time comes experience and improvement naturally if you stick to it, so my ability as a rapper, engineer and producer just got better and better with each project. Even with performance, I’d done more shows which gave me more confidence when connecting with a crowd.

3.Beyond the release of the “Meditape 3” mixtape what do you have planned next?
As well as coming up on BBC Radio 1’s Big Weekender there will be more visuals, production and projects. It never stops so the plans to keep going. I want to push more boundaries and showcase the development that took place over the past year so right now it’s about maintaining the momentum and giving people good music. You will be able to catch me at my show at Blues Kitchen, Manchester – Thursday, August 5th then back to the studio!


4.Outside of your genre, who would you like to collab with which might surprise people?

I’d like to collab with a person like FKJ or even the likes of Terrace Martin. They produce amazing music, in a way that’s very true to itself. 

Questions is a single taken from Sleepz’s upcoming 12-track mixtape which lands later in May, featuring MC and choreographer Blackhaine.
